wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Frederick Henry Hall, 1st Baronet,   (7 October 1864 – 28 April 1932) was a British businessman and politician. During World War I he was active in recruiting men for 'Kitchener's Army'.

response: * Sir Frederick Hall, 1st Baronet (1864–1932), British Conservative Member of Parliament for Dulwich 1910–1932
*Sir Frederick Hall, 1st Baronet; MP for Dulwich (1910–1932)

response: * Lt-Col Sir Frederick Hall, 1st Baronet, DSO, MP, a member of Lloyd's of London, appointed 23 May 1923, died 28 April 1932'Hall of Grafham', Burke's.
